findEntry

connect

public void connect(PeerEntry entry)
Here are the steps to making a connection into the network 1) A new peer sends a connect request to its known peers. once a peer is found that can service this request it will proccess the request. 2) A connected message is sent back to the the peer with the topology of the network segment. 3) All peers in the network are sent a insert message to tell them to insert the new peer into their copy of the topology.

connect

public void connect(PeerEntry entry,
                    boolean bAuto)

connected

public void connected(java.lang.String peer,
                      java.lang.String xml)
This is step 2 in the connection proccess I have asked to be connected and someone has responded back to me with the new topology.

insert

public void insert(Envelope env)
This is step 3 in the connection proccess I've been called by the peer so I can update my copy of the topology.

update

public void update(Envelope env)
This is one of the steps in the repair process we need to update everyone that knew about the dropout peer with the replacement peer.

disconnect

public final void disconnect()
This is called by the transceiver so that the networkagent can inform all peers it is directly connected too that it is dropping out of the network.

replace

public final void replace(java.lang.String address,
                          java.lang.String xml)
This is received from a message post to inform this peer that an adjacent peer has droped out of the peer network are we are stepping in

disconnected

public final void disconnected()
This is received from a message post to inform this peer that an adjacent peer has droped out of the peer network. We we received this message there was a problem and we will need to reconnect to the network to maintain integrity all of our peers should reconenct.
